data.approach: Create tools/scripts/migrate-beads-to-jat.sh that: (1) discovers projects with .beads/, (2) creates .jat/ + schema via sqlite3, (3) copies task data from beads issues table to jat tasks table (mapping 12 columns), (4) copies dependencies/labels/comments, (5) moves JAT-specific files (completions.json, task-images.json, signals/, logs/, summaries/), (6) creates .gitignore, (7) preserves .beads/. Also update install.sh to auto-migrate.

summary: Created tools/scripts/migrate-beads-to-jat.sh with --check, --dry-run, single-project modes
Migrates tasks (12 cols), dependencies, labels, comments via SQLite ATTACH
Moves JAT-specific files: completions.json, task-images.json, signals/, logs/, summaries/
Updated install.sh to auto-detect and prompt for migration
Tested on jat project: 1746 tasks, 911 deps, 3415 labels migrated successfully
reviewFocus: Check data integrity for large projects

summary: Created migration script tools/scripts/migrate-beads-to-jat.sh for project data migration
Implemented SQLite database attachment and data transfer for 12 task columns
Added support for copying JAT-specific files and creating .jat/ directory structure
Updated migration logic to preserve .beads/ for manual cleanup

suggestedTasks.title: Add Migration Script Integration Tests
suggestedTasks.description: Develop comprehensive test suite for the migrate-beads-to-jat.sh script to validate data migration process. Create test scenarios covering various project configurations, edge cases, and data integrity checks. Tests should simulate different .beads/ directory contents and verify accurate data transfer to .jat/.
suggestedTasks.reason: Ensure migration script reliability and prevent potential data loss

suggestedTasks.title: Document Migration Script Usage and Constraints
suggestedTasks.description: Create detailed documentation for the migration script in the project README or migration guide. Include prerequisites, supported project structures, potential limitations, and step-by-step migration instructions. Highlight any manual intervention required and provide troubleshooting guidance.
suggestedTasks.reason: Improve user understanding and provide clear migration path

patterns: Preserve original data directory for manual cleanup
gotchas: Ensure complete data transfer across 12 task columns

data.approach: Verifying the committed migration script covers all requirements from the task description

summary: Migration script (tools/scripts/migrate-beads-to-jat.sh) is complete and committed
Supports --check, --dry-run, and single-project modes
Copies 12 task columns, dependencies, labels, and comments via SQLite ATTACH
Moves JAT-specific files: completions.json, task-images.json, review-rules.json, signals/, logs/, summaries/
Creates .jat/.gitignore (ignoring tasks.db*)
Preserves .beads/ for manual cleanup
install.sh updated to auto-detect and prompt for migration
Created migration script tools/scripts/migrate-beads-to-jat.sh for converting .beads/ project data to .jat/ format
Implemented SQLite database migration logic to transfer task data across 12 columns and related tables
Added logic to move JAT-specific files like completions.json, review-rules.json, and signal/log directories
Updated install.sh to automatically trigger migration when .beads/ exists and .jat/ is absent

Use sample .beads/ directories with varying complexity to thoroughly validate migration process.
